definition: to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full

sentences.english: And I told the exiles everything the LORD had shown me.
sentences.chinese: 我遂向充軍的人講述上主給我顯示的一切事。

sentences.english: Around the officer agreed to free base banishment.
sentences.chinese: 各地軍官一致同意免賤充軍。

sentences.english: And the children of Israel of the captivity kept the phase, on the fourteenth day of the first month.
sentences.chinese: 由充軍歸來的子民，於正月十四日，舉行了逾越節。

sentences.english: Weeks later, etc, were donated to banishment jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 周後等悉捐珠寶，資充軍需。

definition: Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Zhao Gao (?-207 BC), one of the most vile, corrupt and powerful eunuchs in Chinese history, responsible for the fall of Qin Dynasty
